str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Commendation, praise, approval. From epi and the base of aineo; laudation; concretely, a commendable thing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To favor, bestow freely on. From charis; to grace, i.e. Indue with special honor.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
